Skin in the game: mink coat at ethical fashion show fuels sustainability debate
description: Eco-concerns upturn moral battle over fur as quiet luxury gives way to ‘boom boom’ looks at Paris fashion weekEllie Violet Bramley: Are you fur real?Gabriela Hearst is an ethical fashion designer, with sustainability at the heart of her brand. And she wants to sell you a mink coat.Hearst’s Paris fashion week show included a coat, jacket and stole made from vintage real fur. “We bought all these old mink coats in Italy, and pieced them together,” she said after her show. Continue reading...
author: Jess Cartner-Morley in Paris

title: Are you fur real? Gone is the social stigma around wearing animal skins | Ellie Violet Bramley
description: From gen Z’s interest in ‘natural’ materials to the darker ‘boom boom’ aesthetic of the Trump era, the trend wheel has turned back to peltsI’ll admit it, Carrie Bradshaw in aviators and a fur coat, smoking and drinking beer while watching baseball, spoke to me. It was season two of Sex and the City, 1999. She was bruised from a recently ended relationship but on the brink of dating “the new Yankee” and I was a teenager, probably home from playing racketball and on the brink of Quorn sausages for dinner.While it wasn’t the whole equation, the fur coat was certainly part of it. The way she could shrink into it and appear nonchalantly, breezily beautiful despite unwashed hair and an aching heart. I’m not proud, but I was young, and this to me then looked like something I wanted a piece of.Ellie Violet Bramley is the Guardian’s acting fashion and lifestyle editor Continue reading...
author: Ellie Violet Bramley

title: Fill Your Cart For Madewell’s Spring Sale With Our Favorite Styles
description: Now that 7 p.m. sunsets are here and the days are getting warmer, we’re eager to clean out our closets and update them with new spring outfits. But we’re also not looking to break the bank. The solution? Madewell’s Spring Loyalty Sale!The editor- and reader-favorite brand is launching its mega sale on March 11 to all Madewell Insiders (but Stars and Access shoppers can start shopping deals today). And nearly everything is on sale for 25% off, both online and in stores. It even includes new arrivals, which are dropping the same day, and bestsellers like the Darted Barrel-Leg Jean for the first time. (Exclusions include select leather and suede outerwear as well as collaboration styles.) We got to see some new styles in person, and have to say that you won’t want to miss out on these, especially while they’re discounted until March 23. From spring must-haves like slip dresses and bootcut jeans to ballet flats and woven handbags, you can cart up and put together head-to-toe outfits from Madewell. Ahead, see our favorite styles across denim, dresses, matching sets, accessories and more to shop during the sale. Add them to your cart now, so you can purchase them ASAP tomorrow, and start living your most stylish life this spring.All linked products are independently selected by our editors. If you purchase any of these products, we may earn a commission.For more can't-miss shopping stories delivered straight to your inbox, sign up for our Most Wanted newsletter.Madewell Jeans & Denim On SaleMadewell houses some of Refinery29 editors’ favorite petite and plus-size jeans, so they should be on your radar this spring, if they’re not already. Many styles are available in petite, standard, tall, plus and curvy sizes, making it easy for all of us to enjoy the classic and on-trend styles. But beyond the extensive jean selection, Madewell also has many other denim styles (like vests and jackets) perfect for Canadian tuxedos and accessories (like clogs) to make surprising statements.Madewell Denim Crewneck Vest, $, available at MadewellThe Darted Barrel-Leg JeanMadewell The Darted Barrel-Leg Jean, $, available at MadewellThe Anouk Platform Clog SandalMadewell The Anouk Platform Clog Sandal, $, available at MadewellDenim Relaxed Carpenter OverallsMadewell Denim Relaxed Carpenter Overalls, $, available at MadewellBubble-Sleeve Jean Bomber JacketMadewell Bubble-Sleeve Jean Bomber Jacket, $, available at MadewellMadewell Dresses On SaleWhether you’re looking for a tried-and-true midi dress that can go from the office to the park to dinner, a casual mini dress for weekend jaunts, or bold maxi dresses for spring parties, Madewell’s dress section has it all. From breezy linen and smocked poplin to stretchy denim dresses, these materials will have you prepared for the transitional weather. And while there’s many classic and versatile silhouettes, keep a look out for trends like bubble hems for a bold and fresh look. Madewell The Melody Bubble-Hem Smocked Midi Dress, $, available at MadewellSmocked Mini DressMadewell Smocked Mini Dress, $, available at MadewellSeamed Squareneck Midi DressMadewell Seamed Squareneck Midi Dress, $, available at MadewellEmbroidered Deep V-Neck Midi DressMadewell Embroidered Deep V-Neck Midi Dress, $, available at MadewellSeamed Mini Dress in Ramey WashMadewell Seamed Mini Dress in Ramey Wash, $, available at MadewellMadewell Bags, Shoes & Jewelry On SaleThe cherry on top of every outfit is the accessories, and Madewell’s new and bestselling styles are hidden treasures worth carting up ASAP. Need convincing? This woven shoulder bag went TikTok-viral and the green colorway quickly sold out. But you can still get your hands on it! The brand also has tons of studded suede bags and belts (both are editor favorites), stylish ballet flats, and a jewelry selection that’s definitely underrated. More spring accessories on sale include silk scarves, denim baseball caps, and patterned crew socks. Madewell The Handwoven Shoulder Bag, $, available at MadewellStudded Western BeltMadewell Studded Western Belt, $, available at MadewellThe Remy Mary Jane FlatMadewell The Remy Mary Jane Flat, $, available at MadewellFloral Hoop EarringsMadewell Floral Hoop Earrings, $, available at MadewellThe Sculptural Buckle Crossbody BagMadewell The Sculptural Buckle Crossbody Bag, $, available at MadewellMadewell Matching Sets On SaleWe love a matching set, and Madewell clearly does as well. The brand has several coordinating separates from a breezy three-piece pinstripe suit and a chic linen top-and-trouser set to a daring denim jacket-and-jorts combo on sale. You can even test out the polka dot resurgence with a cami-and-maxi skirt set. The midi lengths will ward off brisk breezes, and the classic styles allow you to accessorize as you please. author: Mercedes Viera

title: Paris Fashion Week Street Style Will Get You Excited For Warmer Weather
description: After a busy February, another fashion month is coming to an end. Paris Fashion Week, which wraps the fall/winter 2025 showcases on March 11, is bringing the stylish festivities to a close. Following Vaquera and Dior kicking off PFW, and debuts from creative directors at Dries Van Noten and Tom Ford, there are still some big names set to take over runways — think Louis Vuitton, Miu Miu, and Chanel  — and, rest assured, crowds of models, designers, editors, content creators, and other industry pros are showing up and out dressed to impress in their best street style looks.  As usual, Paris Fashion Week attendees are doing what they do best: putting effortlessly stylish spins on the year’s biggest trends in a way that only they can. Think: modern-day LBDs, silhouettes that are just the right amount of oversized, extravagant coats, playful peep-toe shoes, ethereal organza, and so much more. Everywhere you look, there’s spring outfit inspiration to be found, whether in the form of styling hacks, new pieces to add to your closet, reinterpretations of well-worn staples, or just overall vibes. Scroll on to discover our favorite Paris Fashion Week street style looks from the fall/winter 2025 shows, and keep checking back as we update this post with more looks throughout the week. title: TikTok Got Me to Try Camel-Toe-Proof Underwear - and It Actually Works
description: Image Source: PS Photography / Renee Rodriguez I'm just going to come right out and say it: it's time to talk about camel toes. We've all been there at one point or another - we slip on our favorite pair of workout leggings and running shoes, only to look in the mirror and see that we can see much more than we bargained for. Namely, the outline of our labia majora. While some of us may have no problem with the idea of showing a little extra, others might not feel so comfortable. I am firmly stationed in the latter camp, which is why when I first heard about the camel-toe-proof Jiv Athletics High Rise Thong ($35), I knew I had to get my hands on a pair immediately. Like most good things in my life, I discovered the existence of camel-toe-proof underwear while scrolling through my TikTok feed late one night. After seeing one video where a woman was praising how amazing the thongs were, I started seeing more and more videos of women calling out Jiv Athletics for their amazing underwear. (Thank you, TikTok algorithm.) While I eagerly awaited the arrival of my own pair, I decided to read up on what made this underwear so different from everything else I had tried in the past. What I Like About the Jiv Athletics Camel-Toe-Proof Thong After receiving them in the mail, I washed them in a delicates bag, hung them to dry, and patiently waited for my turn to finally be free of my dreaded camel toe. The first time I wore them I decided to try them on with a pair of leggings I purchased a few months ago. In all honesty, I hadn't worn my leggings even once since I purchased them, because no matter how many different pairs of underwear I tried on with them, I was always left with bunching in the crotch area. (I run into this issue a lot with leggings that have a seam down the center.) After I put on my new panties, I immediately noticed how lightweight the fabric was. It honestly felt like butter, and I loved the fact that they were seamless, so I wouldn't run into any issues with panty lines. The underwear is also tag-less, which already made them more comfortable than half of the options in my panty drawer. I wore them all day, and with the exception of when I had to use the restroom, I honestly forgot I was wearing underwear at all – they were that comfortable. And as for my camel toe? I'll spare you the before photo, but let's just say I would not be wearing these leggings without the assistance of my new favorite underwear. Who Is the Jiv Athletics Camel-Toe-Proof Thong Best For? If you wear tight-fitting clothing, including workout shorts or leggings, this is the underwear to grab. I'm excited to know that I can now purchase any leggings without needing to worry about bunching, readjusting, or feeling self-conscious. If you're like me, and have been searching for the answer to your camel toe woes, pick up a pair to add to your underwear collection. Additional Details These underwear are made with recycled fabrics and environmentally friendly dyes. They're also made from 82/18 percent recycled micro-polyester spandex, and they have an anti-microbial cotton gusset as well as a moisture-wicking outer shell and breathable cotton liner, which helps promote airflow *down there*. The real magic is in the 3D knitted molded spacer fabric, which provides an extra layer of coverage that makes camel toes a thing of the past. Where Is the Jiv Athletics Camel-Toe-Proof Thong Available? The Jiv Athletics camel-toe-proof thong is available to shop on the brand's website and on Amazon. Rating Renee Rodriguez (she/her) is a staff writer and social producer for PS. She writes across all verticals, but her main areas of expertise focus on fashion and beauty content with an emphasis on reviews and editor experiments. She also produces social content for the PS TikTok and Instagram accounts.
author: Renee Rodriguez

title: The Street Style Trends You'll See All Over This Season, as Worn by Our Editors
description: Fashion Week introduces trends for the season to come, but it also keeps us firmly rooted in the current moment through street style. What people wear while skipping from one show to the next is often just as inspiring as anything you'll see walking down the runway - if not more so. New York Fashion Week is back to its roots with a packed schedule of in-person shows and events, running over the course of five days. It brings together style enthusiasts from across the world, all looking toward the coming season. This year, they stepped out in bold sartorial statements, from charmcore jewelry and accessories to corpcore suiting that turned heads. Other noteworthy street style trends included tenniscore skirts, coordinating sets, and dopamine dressing. On the footwear front, show goers continued to favor platforms and also took a tip from the runways by opting for stylish and comfortable walking shoes. But kitten heels, sneakers, and ballet flats remained a go-to for those looking to strike a balance between fashion and function. Outerwear favorites were primarily bold-hued and worn oversize, with statement trench coats cinched at the waist reigning supreme. And some of the top handbag brands spotted on style stars? Prada, Louis Vuitton, Bottega Veneta, Saint Laurent, Staud, Coperni, and Brandon Blackwood, just to name a few. This season, PS Shopping's senior content director Jessica Andrews and associate director Sarah Wasilak attended NYFW shows sporting many shoppable new trends. Still, looks worn by past editors continue to remain relevant. Keep reading for a full recap on what the editorial team wore to Fashion Week through the season, and refresh your wardrobe with their exact items.
author: Mekita Rivas
